intro: Thespesia fissicalyx, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, including Hawaii. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has broad, waxy leaves and produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds. Thespesia fissicalyx thrives in coastal areas and is well adapted to saline and sandy soils.
